column1: Hadgaon is a town and a municipal council in Nanded district in the Indian state of Maharashtra. Kednarth Temple is located at Kedarguda village about 16 kilometres from the town and attracts pilgrims. Also there are religious temples of Lord Datta & Renuka at Datta Bardi and Ukhlai Ashram
column3: Ganpati Mandir in old town. Hadgaon was main place of activist in Marathwada Mukti Sangram Led by Swami Ramanand Teerth. It has an average elevation of 899 metres (1358 feet).

column2: Hadgaon had a population of 58347. Males constitute 52% of the population and females 48%. Hadgaon has an average literacy rate of 65%
column3: higher than the national average of 59.5%: male literacy is 73%
